On 7/12/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

>  > As far as the categories=
 go, I would like to see a simple method-level
>  > annotation that looks l=
ike this:
>  >
>  > @TestGroups=3D{"nightly", "quick", "bug"}
>
>  Any take=
rs on identifying categories with classes?
>
>  @TestGroups({Nightly.class,=
 Quick.class, Bug.class})
>
>  I'm thinking:
>
>  - auto-completion
>  - re=
factoring
>  - easy hook for running (just run Nightly.class to get the Nig=
htly build)
>  - easy place for further customization (@BeforeClass, @After=
Class, etc)

Interesting thought, but an advantage of string groups is that=
 you can
run your tests by specifying group regexps (very powerful).

For e=
xample, some of our users define groups such as
"database.accounts", "datab=
ase.people", or "win32.gui".

Then you can run an entire category of groups=
 by including
"database.*" or you can be more specific by including
"databa=
se.people" if you know your latest change only touched code
that modifies t=
he table PEOPLE.

-- 
C=E9dric
